text: was a after Ōhō and before Eiman. This period started in March 1163 and ended in June 1165.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Chōkan" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 120. The reigning emperors were and .Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du japon, pp. 193-195; Brown, Delmer et al. (1979). Gukanshō, pp. 329-330; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki. p. 212. ==Events of the Chōkan era== * 1163 (Chōkan 1, 1st month): Taira no Shigemori was promoted to the second rank of the 3rd class in the court hierarchy.Titsingh, p. 193. * 1163 (Chōkan 2, 2nd month): At Tōdai-ji and Kōfuku-ji, prayers were offered for the prosperity of the Imperial family. * 14 September 1164 (Chōkan 2, on the 26th day of the 8th month): Former-Emperor Sutoku died at the age of 46.Brown, p. 328; Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), 崇徳天皇 (75). Retrieved 2012-5-22. ==Related pages== * Heian period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Chōkan 1st 2nd 3rd Gregorian 1163 1164 1165 Preceded by: Ōhō Era or nengō: Chōkan Succeeded by: Eiman Category:Japanese eras
title: Chōkan
